case_vignette: A 47-year-old man comes to the emer   gency department because of urinary and fecal incontinence for 6 hours. Earlier in the day, he suffered a fall at a construc   tion site    and sustained injuries to his back a nd thighs but did    not seek medical attention. He took ibup rofen for lower back pain. His temperature is 36.9°C (98.4°F), pulse is 80/min, and blood    pressure is 132/84 mm Hg. Examination shows t enderness over the lumbar spine, bilateral lower extremity weakness, absent ankle jerk reflexes, and pres   erve  d patellar reflexes. There is decreased rectal    tone. An ultrasound of the bladder shows a   full bladder.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing urinary and fecal incontinence for about 6 hours.
Have you experienced any recent trauma or injuries to your head or spine?
Yes, I suffered a fall at a construction site earlier in the day, injuring my back and thighs.
Are you experiencing any numbness, weakness, or tingling in your legs or lower body?
Yes, I have weakness in both of my lower extremities.
Do you currently have any changes in sensation, such as areas that are overly sensitive or completely numb, around your buttocks, thighs, or genital regions?
I have decreased rectal tone, but there's no specific mention of changes in sensation around my buttocks, thighs, or genital regions in my symptoms.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cauda Equina Syndrome
